meanings.definition: A problem that is part of a larger problem.
meanings.sent1: When working on the math homework, I found a subproblem that was challenging.
meanings.sent2: The subproblem of fixing the leaky faucet was just one part of renovating the bathroom.
meanings.sent3: I tried to ignore the subproblem of my messy desk, but it kept getting in the way.
meanings.sent4: Her lack of confidence was a subproblem that hindered her from reaching her full potential.
meanings.sent5: The subproblem of finding a parking spot in the crowded city was like a puzzle to solve.

meanings.definition: A smaller problem that needs to be solved in order to solve a larger problem.
meanings.sent1: Before we could launch the new product, we had to address the subproblem of packaging design.
meanings.sent2: The subproblem of securing funding was crucial for the success of the research project.
meanings.sent3: Trying to decide on a restaurant for dinner became a subproblem when everyone had different preferences.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of public speaking was a subproblem that needed to be overcome before she could lead the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The subproblem of fixing the broken printer delayed the completion of the important report.
